Maimonidesg citing these words writes thus3 “ A widow, whether she became a widow after marriage, 01· after espousal, is bound by oath, and sells a piece of land of her husband's'' (for her maintemmce), “either in the court of the mzmnelcin, the authorized, or in ΓΠΌἾὩ ῙΞἾΝΨ the court of those that are not authorized5 now that court or bench is, when three men are present that are honest and skilful in valuing a piece of land.”

To this very ordinary bench among the Jews, the apostle seems to have respect in this place, and to prescribe it to the Oorinthians for a means of ending their differences which was easy, common, and void of cost- and charges.
